page.title: 01Description of the Area
page.content: This an area of great scenic beauty,especially when viewed from the hills on either side of the glacier valley,through which the river Conwy flows. It includes land up to 350 metres above sea level, meadows for hay and grazing, the market town of Llanrwst and part of the village of Trefriw. One large and several small lakes are found in the hills in the West. Conifer forests, natural woodland, moorland and bogland are interspersed with rocky outcrops. The area is ideally suited to outdoor pursuits but also provides scope for farming both on the valley floor and in the hills. It is a stronghold of the Welsh language which is spoken and used in teaching. A great many people speak Welsh in their everyday affairs.
